item.title: Auction Theory Basics
item.description: Auctions are allocation mechanisms1. Notations Naively, an auction is observed to have several factors. To save keystrokes, we use a set of symbols to denote the variables: the seller $\mathscr S$, the bidders $\{\mathscr B_i\}$, the object $\mathscr O$ to bid on, the bidding prices $\{b_i\}$. In an auction, each bidder $\mathscr B_i$ decides on a valuation $v_i$ of the object $\mathscr O$ and bid with a bidding price $b_i$ based on the valuation.
